image.altText: Stephen Mitchell sits at a cafe holding a take-away coffee cup.

props.synopsis: Stephen Mitchell is already serving a jail term for sexual offences against six girls during his time as a national rock climbing coach.

title.children: 'He took advantage of me': Convicted paedophile is given more jail time for separate act of indecency

image.altText: Lia Finocchiaro, Andrew Barr and Elizabeth Lee.

props.synopsis: Could the surprise devastation witnessed in the Northern Territory election a few months ago foreshadow a similar result in the ACT this weekend, or is the shared "territory" label where the similarities between the NT and the ACT end?

title.children: According to this expert, there is one key thing the Canberra Liberals need to do to unseat Labor

image.altText: An aerial view of Lake Burley Griffin soon after filling up in 1964.

props.synopsis: It's played host to everything from nude swimmers and the Queen of England — not at the same time — to hot air balloons and giant Murray Cod. As Canberra marks 60 years since the inauguration of Lake Burley Griffin, let's take a look at how far it's come.

title.children: It's been 60 years since Lake Burley Griffin was first filled but it wasn't all smooth sailing

image.altText: A room with ocean views.

props.synopsis: From flipping the bird at a journalist to scooping up a clifftop abode before an election, "leaders who made decisions that felt good in the moment but have brought with them distracting headaches" has been a theme in politics this week.

title.children: Elizabeth Lee's finger and Anthony Albanese's house: The decisions that may bring distracting headaches

image.altText: ACT Labor Leader Andrew Barr stands on a stage speaking behind a podium.

props.synopsis: The ACT chief minister says it was a mistake to appoint Walter Sofronoff to head an inquiry into the trial of Bruce Lehrmann.

title.children: Barr says Sofronoff's appointment to board of inquiry a 'mistake'

image.altText: a woman giving the finger at a man as he walks away

props.synopsis: Elizabeth Lee made the gesture towards a journalist at a press conference after the ACT Property Council's leaders' debate on Wednesday.

title.children: Canberra Liberals leader Elizabeth Lee makes rude gesture at journalist following tense press conference exchange

image.altText: A group of people holding signs and flags walk in a protest rally.

props.synopsis: Staff at the Australian National University in Canberra have been asked to forgo an agreed pay rise amid efforts to get the university's budget under control.

title.children: 'I know this is a big ask': ANU staff urged to forgo agreed pay rise to keep university afloat

image.altText: A plane with 'Batik' branding begins its take-off from the runway.

props.synopsis: The airline says it will reinstate the Canberra to Denpasar services when market conditions are more conductive.

title.children: Batik Air suspends flights indefinitely between Canberra and Bali four months after they started

image.altText: Four people standing at electronic voting booths.

props.synopsis: From news, analysis and explainers through to election previews, key electorates and candidates, ACT Votes has the latest on the upcoming state election. Click through to read more.

title.children: ACT Votes 2024 — stay up to date with the latest election news and analysis

image.altText: Liam Payne photographed in Paris in March 2024.

props.synopsis: Liam Payne rose to superstardom with One Direction before he even turned 18. Payne's later years were marred by his experience in one of the biggest groups of the 21st century.

title.children: Liam Payne spent his formative years in the world's biggest boy band. It had a lasting impact on his career and life

image.altText: James Davis wearing a cap

props.synopsis: James-Robert Davis's former partner said she was tattooed, forced to wear a collar, and told to sign a contract making her a "slave", while she was subjected to his control.

title.children: Man accused of running a sex cult on a rural NSW property jailed for assaulting woman he 'enslaved'

image.altText: A grey US B-2 stealth bomber attack aircraft seen flying through the rear entry of another military plane.

props.synopsis: US Defense Secretary Lloyd Austin described the strikes as a "unique demonstration" against the country's adversaries.

title.children: US bombers target underground Houthi bunkers

props.synopsis: US Vice-President Kamala Harris has been grilled in a televised interview on the Biden administration's efforts to tackle a surge in illegal immigration at the southern border, blaming Republicans for failing to pass a border bill.

title.children: Kamala Harris pressed on immigration, Biden's fitness for office in first interview with Fox News

image.altText: Andrew and Nicola stand side by side on the Perth foreshore

props.synopsis: Andrew and Nicola Forrest are stepping down from the philanthropic foundation they founded together, with the news coming just over a year after they announced their marriage separation.

title.children: Andrew, Nicola Forrest to step down from philanthropic organisation Minderoo, a year after separating as a couple

image.altText: Storm clouds brewing at night, with shades of blue and green, over green pastures

props.synopsis: A spell of wild weather is on the cards for everywhere from Queensland to Tasmania, with thunderstorms forecast to sweep across Australia's east over the next 48 hours.

title.children: Wild weather predicted across Australia's south-east over next 48 hours

image.altText: Josh Fahey handballs for GWS against North Melbourne during a 2023 AFL match.

props.synopsis: The AFL punishes 13 current and former GWS players after investigating allegations of inappropriate behaviour, which included simulated "acts on a sex doll".

title.children: AFL hands down sanctions to Giants players over 'completely unacceptable' post-season function

image.altText: King Charles points to Elder Abe Muriata while speaking. They are sitting down. King Charles wears medals on his left.

props.synopsis: The king and queen are coming to Sydney and Canberra this week but what do mob think about the visit and what would they like to see happen while he’s here?

title.children: Should King Charles say sorry during his visit for the hurt caused through colonisation?

image.altText: Cotton crops in a large paddock

props.synopsis: A foreign company has acquired Australia's biggest cotton ginning business for about $160 million, ending an eight-month bidding war and intervention by the competition watchdog.

title.children: Foreign agriculture giant acquires Australia's biggest cotton ginning company for $160 million

image.altText: White space suit with grey parts and red stripes

props.synopsis: The first woman on the moon will be wearing a Prada space suit, as part of NASA's first human mission to the lunar South Pole. The suit has been designed for NASA's Artemis III,  planned for 2026.

title.children: Astronauts set to wear designer space suits in the first moon landing since 1972

image.altText: Moon rising over hills on horizon.

props.synopsis: Our skies have already been graced by two supermoons this year but tonight's hunter's moon will be the brightest.

title.children: Everything to know about the year's brightest supermoon set to light up skies tonight

image.altText: Former New Zealand prime minister Jacinda Ardern poses wearing a traditional Maori cloak in front of Windsor Castle.

props.synopsis: The former New Zealand prime minister has been formally recognised during a ceremony held at Windsor Castle.

title.children: Jacinda Ardern granted royal honour by Prince William

image.altText: Erik Menendez (R) and brother Lyle listen to court proceedings during a May 17, 1991 appearance.

props.synopsis: Several of the family members say that in today's world — which is more aware of the impact of sexual abuse — Erik and Lyle Menendez would not have been jailed for the rest of their lives.

title.children: 'Today we know better': Family say Menendez brothers should have got lenient sentences

image.altText: An older woman is held by two men, standing in a garden

props.synopsis: NSW Police have argued their actions in the lead up to Tammy Shipley's death in custody are “too remote” to be examined in a coronial inquest.

title.children: Police defend actions after Aboriginal woman who drank 20 litres of water died in custody

image.altText: Floral tributes that were left at the scene.

props.synopsis: David George Connolly, 43, died after being wounded in the chest by the then 17-year-old boy on Newmarket Road in Wilston in 2023.

title.children: Teenager who stabbed a man with a 40-centimetre knife in Brisbane's inner north found guilty of manslaughter

image.altText: A man stands on the front porch of a house, behind a sign that says 'Trump 2024'.

props.synopsis: Soon after Donald Trump claimed Haitian migrants were eating cats and dogs in Ohio, he turned his attention to another part of the US.

title.children: 'Not so beautiful now': After amplifying a pet-eating conspiracy, Trump took aim at migrants in another town

image.altText: Sandon Smith warming up before an NRL match.

props.synopsis: Roosters halfback Sandon Smith will face court after being charged with negligent driving occasioning grievous bodily harm.

title.children: Sydney Roosters NRL player to face court on driving charge

image.altText: Russian rescuers dressed in reflective safety clothing carrying a man dressed in blue in a hammock stretcher.

props.synopsis: Mikhail Pichugin spent 67 days battling the cold and drinking rainwater, but the two relatives who were in the boat with him both died.

title.children: Man survives months stranded at sea after Siberian whale watching trip goes wrong

image.altText: A man standing in front of a house

props.synopsis: Investors with 10 or more properties to their name have more debt than smaller-scale investors but use negative gearing and capital gains discounts to keep buying, tax office data shows.

title.children: New data reveals thousands of Australians who own 10 rentals or more

image.altText: People standing outside a cream buildings wearing masks

props.synopsis: The Archdiocese of Los Angeles has agreed to pay $US880 million ($1.3 billion) to victims of clergy sexual abuse dating back decades, in what has been announced as the largest single child sex abuse settlement with a Catholic archdiocese.

title.children: Archdiocese of Los Angeles agrees to pay $US880 million to victims of clergy sexual abuse

image.altText: Widodo smiling and waving

props.synopsis: A 75 per cent approval rating is unimaginable to incumbent leaders in most other democracies around the world.

title.children: Indonesia's Jokowi has his critics, but leaves office more popular than any leader before him

image.altText: The clasped feet of a ten-month-old baby boy on a blue rug.

props.synopsis: The national birth rate has hit a record low and is now at a critical level, with economic consequences for the future.

title.children: Australia's 'perilously low' birth rate approaches point of no return

image.altText: A power tower in a paddock.

props.synopsis: A severe storm has left Broken Hill and the surrounding region without power and the power infrastructure company says it could take weeks to fix the damage.

title.children: Outback city running on generators after wild storm crumples transmission towers

image.altText: Liam Hooper sits at a cafe table on a city street.

props.synopsis: Staring at a third recession in just two years, Kiwis are moving across the ditch to Australia in substantial numbers, seeking a sunnier economic climate.

title.children: New Zealand's economic woes lure thousands of Kiwis to Australia

image.altText: man gather in a street

props.synopsis: Lebanon's second-largest city, Tripoli, has largely been spared the Israeli air strikes smashing the country's south, Beqaa Valley and southern Beirut. But, the influx of refugees has exposed ongoing tensions in the country between its Shia, Sunni and Christian communities.

title.children: In Lebanon, some towns fear Hezbollah members are among the Shia refugees pouring in

props.synopsis: Straw might seem like the last product you'd use if you wanted to protect your house from fire, but these straw panels, made from waste material, are a secret weapon against flames.

title.children: Why using straw panels to protect against bushfire was a 'no-brainer' for this couple
